Element.name: Module
Element.Description: A Module is a reference to a reusable fragment of interaction flow model defined by a Module Definition. The navigation enters from an input Port and exits from an output Port, optionally bringing parameters along. Which output Port is used for exiting depends on the internal model of the Module Definition.
Element.Action: Goes to the Module Definition that this Module refers to.

PropertyCategory.name: General
PropertyCategory.Property: If checked, this module is accessed when the ancestor Site View is accessed.
If checked, a flow will appear in the corresponding landmark menu that will access this module.
If checked, the access to this module is permitted only to users belonging to a group entitled to access it.
If checked, all the flows whose navigation can access this module are implemented using the secure HTTP protocol, instead of the HTTP protocol.
If checked, the layout pages generated from this module do not include the Master Container elements. Enabled only when refering to Hybrid Module Definitions.
The Module Definition to which this Module refers.
If checked, the generated layout page does not include the Master Container.

PropertyCategory.name: Appearance
PropertyCategory.Property: A distinctive icon displayed in the diagram and in the outline.
If checked, all parts belonging to the module will be displayed.
